edu.uiuc.ncsa.security.util.pkcs

Class CertUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uiuc.ncsa.security.util.pkcs.CertUtil

  • public class CertUtil
extends Object
    Utilities for formatting certs and other things. Cert requests are handled in PKCS10 format. Certificates are encoded in PEM as PKCS12 (default) or as PKCS7 if so requested.

    Created by Jeff Gaynor
    on Jun 15, 2010 at 2:45:47 PM

      • getX509CertsFromStringList

        public static X509Certificate[] getX509CertsFromStringList(String[] certList,
                                                           String[] nameList)
                                                    throws CertificateException
        A utility that will take a list of Base64 encoded X509 certificates and convert them into an array of java.security.cert.X509Certificate objects.
        Parameters:
        certList -
        nameList - The array of file names corresponding to each cert. This is only used to generate error messages and if it is omitted will not otherwise effect function.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        CertificateException

      • toPEM

        public static void toPEM(X509Certificate x509Certificate,
                         OutputStream outputStream)
                  throws CertificateEncodingException
        Take an X509 cert and encode it correctly in PEM format, writing the result to the output stream. This will check for a known condition in various security suites (e.g. Open SSL) in which an extra line feed will cause the entire result to be rejected. This extra line feed occurs in the odd case that the encoded cert's length is a multiple of the line length. The only way to catch this is to encode it as a string, then check if the last character is a line feed.
        Parameters:
        x509Certificate -
        outputStream -
        Throws:
        CertificateEncodingException

      • fromStringToCertReq

        public static MyPKCS10CertRequest fromStringToCertReq(String x)
        Take a string that is an base64-encoded, DER-encoded PKCS10 certificate request,. This is, for instance stored in a database and not PEM format.

        Returns:

        dn -
        Returns:

      • getEPPN

        public static String getEPPN(X509Certificate x509Certificate)
        IF the user has an EPPN or EPTID, it will be in a specific extension to the cert. Since that requires a bit of Voodoo (the extension value) to get, this call will perform that, returning either a null if no such item exists or the value.
        Parameters:
        x509Certificate -
        Returns:

      • getEmail

        public static String getEmail(X509Certificate x509Certificate)

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        Command line utility to generate a keypair with a given DN. This is intended for low level debugging, not public consumption. This is a very stupid utility but much more convenient than using openSSL or some other such command line utility.
        Parameters:
        args -
